review_title: This college needs a lot of work
pros: The best part of working at Villa Maria is the immediate impact you can make on the education of a student.  Since the college has such lax admission standards, many students are quickly overwhelmed with the basics of a college course load.  Luckily, the college offers many remedial opportunities for students to catch up to a college level.  Thus, assuming the student wants to learn, these opportunities present a chance for immediate learning.  That can be a very rewarding experience.
cons:
While I alluded to the fact that you can make an immediate impact on students, this comes at a price. Admissions criteria are woefully low.  Thus, many students have education levels that would seemingly cause them to struggle at the middle years of a high school.  Moreover, many students do not seem to take their classes serious.  While this may be common around the country, at such high tuition rates, it is clear the time spent at Villa Maria is causing them more harm then good.  It seems in many respects that the college is desperate to maintain admissions numbers.  

Additionally, while I worked at Villa Maria, I noticed several quality employees were forced out by poor administration and nepotistic behavior.  Those who should have a greater impact on school policy are often relegated by those completely inept to make such decisions.
